name: Decimal Dungeon
description:
Decimal Dungeon is a educational math game for one or two players.

Designed to teach students about decimals and fractions, the player must help navigate a man through a haunted dungeon. Numerous stalagmites block the player's path, but if the player correctly answers a math question, the stalagmites will temporarily lower to the ground allowing the player to pass. If the player answers incorrectly, they are dumped through a trap door by a bat. The goal is to reach the top of the levels by continuously answering questions correctly. It contains three levels of difficulty, and a variety of different math problems including converting fractions, decimals, and percentages, as well as addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division questions.
alsoFor: Amiga, Apple II, Commodore 64 | Combined View

shot.caption: Choose what types of decimal math problems to have in the game.

Answering a math problem correctly will allow you to proceed though the cavern.
After finishing both screens, you must try to catch the bat.
